turns.content: why is alcohol the only drink people binge on?

There are several reasons why alcohol is more commonly consumed in large quantities or "binged" on than other types of beverages. One reason is that alcohol is a central nervous system depressant, which means that it can produce feelings of relaxation and reduced inhibitions in small amounts. However, as people consume more and more alcohol, these effects can become more pronounced, leading to impaired judgment, coordination, and decision-making. This can make it more likely for people to continue drinking to excess.

Another factor that may contribute to binge drinking is the social and cultural norms surrounding alcohol consumption. In many societies, alcohol is a widely available and socially accepted substance that is often consumed in social settings. This can make it easier for people to drink to excess, especially if they are influenced by peer pressure or trying to fit in with a certain social group.

It is also worth noting that other substances, such as drugs, can also be consumed in large quantities or "binged" on. However, alcohol is one of the most widely used and socially accepted substances, which may explain why it is more commonly associated with binge drinking.
